Reviews.Title: “Super service”
Reviews.Author: MrTall_99
Reviews.Content: Great location close to airport close to metro and close to city. I arrived at 08.00 but they checked me in no problem meaning I didn't have to wait 6 hours wifi and breakfast was free with my gold membership along with a room upgrade. Room was normal holiday inn, clean quiet, comfortable with big bathroom and powerful shower. Rooftop pool was deserted and gave me nice chance to recharge. Good buffet lunch was 50 UAE and great little cafe on main st by metro (automatic cafeteria) did super shwarma and fresh orange juice for 40 UAE. Dubai mall is 6 or so metro stops away (16 uae return) and I will definitely stay again at this well priced gem where service was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Not that much”
Reviews.Author: rberaiki
Reviews.Content: Stayed on that hotel for it's proximity to the old Dubai town so my mother could go very quickly to the old market in Deira Area. The fact is that this hotel is a little old and tired, also very much crammed between a very congested area. Not that bad, but there are plenty of hotels that are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sludge_74
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Holiday Inn Downtown Dubai with our twins in March 2010. The location is perfect. Within 5 minutes you are at the Al Rigga Metro station with connections to the various sites across town. on a positive side we would like to highlight: - the very friendly and helpfull staff - rooms are clean and tidy - good food selection (both breakfast and dinner!) on a not so great side: - make sure you get a room on a higher level as the noise from the club downstairs makes sleeping almost impossible until 2 or 3 am - the rooms are very small but nice and clean If you're after a reasonably priced hotel in a good location go for the Holiday Inn downtown. But do be aware of not so great aspects

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Hosseinhamidi
Reviews.Content: - No free Internet access, every day around 30$ - Night club noise in 2nd floor, makes sleeping uncomfortable - Less value than you pay for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't call it value for money”
Reviews.Author: ashishvb
Reviews.Content: We visited Dubai on the first weekend of Feb-2011. It is a time when Dubai and the Middle East has good weather and as a result Dubai was extremely busy. We selected from an array of hotels Holiday Inn based on my previous good experience with Holiday Inn. But I must say this one lacked in the kind of service we expected. Murphy's law took complete control. We had specifically requested for a king sized bed and all I get is 2 separate single beds. Also, there were no other rooms free with a double bed. All we had to make do was with a makeshift double bed. The hotel "restaurant" on the top floor was mediocre in terms of ambiance. The breakfast was average. Overall, I would say that it was just not value for money. I could have rather stayed at a simple B&B hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Decent. Near train station”
Reviews.Author: FMD88528
Reviews.Content: holiday inn downtown dubai seems like an old hotel with no major renovation done for quite some time. i was upgraded to an executive room, though, with gave me internet access. it is also near to the al rigga train station, another plus factor. breakfast was so-so.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired around the edges”
Reviews.Author: S666JPR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way back from Australia, the hotel is looking a bit tired and dated, especially the roof top pool area, it is not dirty or anything just a bit dated. However, the staff really made up for this they were friendly, helpfull and pleasant throughout the stay. Value for money is second to none, the food was nice, hot and tasty with a buffet option available evening meal for 65 d's (around £8) for as much as you could eat. Breakfast was plentyfull and hot, individual eggs cooked however you wanted them. Make sure you only use registered taxi's at the airport, we got into a car, on arrival at the hotel, the driver asked for 120d's for the trip and would I pay him in the car so no one could see, it took around 15 mins and should of cost less than 35d's (we didn't pay !!!!). The registered taxi's all have coloured roofs, they are not plain coloured cars .....

Reviews.Title: “Fading Charms and erratic front desk”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel from the Holiday Inn Express Jumeriah Beach, and don't feel I make a good move in terms of both quality and value for money. This hotel needs an makeover in the communal areas. The bar, the reception and the resteraunts are all very old and shabby. My bedroom was very good, but they may have been because it was on the exective floor. The swimming pool on the roof is tiny, and in need of some care; it's not a place to hangout. My opinion of this hotel was set from the off by the reception, the man checking me in had to refer every single simple question - "is there broadband" (no) ? "is breakfast included" (no) ? to the manager stood next to him, even though the manager was doing nothing he continued to ignore his floundering colleague and carried on playing on his computer. If I was more sure of the cultural rules I'd have probably have lost my temper with their behaviour, as it was a bit my lip and suffered in silence. Of the six of seven members of reception I dealt with over the two days, I would say only two of them know their jobs well enough. Best thing about this hotel is the night club on the first, not advertised at the front desk - I only found it by accident. It's hosted by a great phillipino band and dance troupe who put on a great event until 3am; playing a whole spectrum of western tunes. Don't know where they got the energy from. There is also an Indian dance club and a Lebanese (?) club on the same floor.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: MGK_11
Reviews.Content: Very convienent to access the metros. Reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD. ROOMS ARE DIRTY AND SMELLY”
Reviews.Author: Messut
Reviews.Content: Hi All, My honoust and straight forward review about this old lowclass hotel. Don't book this hotel in Deira, it's old in a bad condition and very smelly. Follow my advice and go for Holiday in Barsha or any others in the area. There are plenty good quality hotels in Downtown in Dubai. Definetely this one is not as expected. Once arrived, a manager called Mr.Cajetan from India at the reception will treat you like if you are not welcome, without respect. Unbelievable. Imagine you arrive late and tired and then this Mr Cajetan (Reception) acts like a Nono in front of you.....I can't believe that a worldclass fivestar hotel hires such unexperienced unprofessional receptionist. Then when you come to your room the very bad room smell and carpet smell is mascared by dozens of toilet refreshers sprayed in the room. Bathroom is dirty, furniture is old and falling in pieces. No view from the windos at all. I will never book this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn out but may be convenient”
Reviews.Author: JMGeneva
Reviews.Content: The hotel might need some refreshing (my room door was not closing (but this has been efficiently fixed in 15 minutes), the swimming pool is not exactly appealing, the furniture is a bit old, etc) but overall the room is rather comfortable and clean. Breakfast is generous if not original. The trick is about location: If you want something rather close to the airport and the old city, this is a good choice, but if you want to be close from the center and modern "attractions" (are there really attractions in Dubai anyway?!) then it will take some time to move around. In my opinion, an hotel to consider if you have little time and don't want to stay at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “short break”
Reviews.Author: tony4848
Reviews.Content: retutning from australia and decieded on a 4 night stopover found staff very helpful and obliging i would recommend getting a price up front from hotel if considering hotel transport; tended to be double local taxi pool area a bit disapointing and some maintenance work needed overall good

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn - maybe not your first choice”
Reviews.Author: rayu66
Reviews.Content: Have been here for a business trip. It is loctated in the older part of Dubai. Not too far away from the airport. I did not use the restaurant, so no idea abaout that, the in-room food was good. Unfortunately the pool-bar and restaurant on the roof-top were closed. the lobby and also the rooms are below the usual Holiday Inn standard, the lobby is quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn downtown is a good 4* & the value for money is great”
Reviews.Author: Raed_Salman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a descent property in a good location. Was perfect for my business trip and very close to major parts of the city. Rooms are very nice, spacious & clean. Also, the quality & variety of breakfast was nice. In addition to that the staff are very friendly and you feel at home when staying in Holiday Inn downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation, especially for stopover en route”
Reviews.Author: BrianCunliffe
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this Holiday Inn albeit for just 2 nights - would have loved to have stayed longer. As previous reviewer stated: very friendly staff, ideal location for metro but do try and get rooms on 5th floor or above etc. We even used the hotel limousine + driver to take us on a city tour and because of our short time in Dubai this proved to be perfect in seeing all the main sites accompanied by an expert driver with very good local knowledge. The Duty Manager, Cajetan Fernandes, even went out of his way to talk to us to ensure that we were happy with everything and did we have any observations to make of the hotel that would improve their service/facilities etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer067
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Fantastic staff that just couldn’t do enough to make, and keep us happy, in particular liked Maxine and Honeylyn they were so helpful. The hotel was clean, nice and fantastically located. It was just a stones throw from a tube station, which is just so handy. It’s in the part of town that has some personality rather than just rows of hotels. It’s well located for lots of tourist attractions. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Just one little proviso, if noise is likely to bother you (it does me!) make sure that you get a room on the 5th floor or higher. The clubs are a noise issue lower down. Would rather the pool had stayed open for longer in the day...closing around 5 was a bit early The area felt safe and we didn’t experience any problems at all whilst in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marwari
Reviews.Content: We had to spend one night in this hotel after we missed our connecting flight. We checked in in the middle of the night, staff was well prepared for the influx of stranded passengers and checked us in quickly. We had a very comfortable room, very nice bed and the location of the hotel is good. The next day we were able to buy some nececssities in the supermarket around the corner (we had no luggage) and walk around a bit. Breakfast and dinner were good and the staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great services!”
Reviews.Author: lavend3rmist
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our Dubai extension trip and everything ended on a great note. Rooms were decently sized and clean, reception and housekeeping staff were very polite. Widespread variety for breakfast at the roof level, we were loving it! The manager even came over and offered his help when we saw us checking out the maps, thumbs up for the initiative! We didn't had time to explore the hotel vicinity, but there were lots of eateries along the main road. Metro was within a couple of minutes walk, we took the Metro to Dubai Mall and Mall of Emirates. We had no issues lugging 3 big bags from the hotel to the Metro, and it took us only 15-20mins to get to the terminal 3.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Erica4983
Reviews.Content: On the day my husband and I planned on going to the water-park i descovered half my swimsuit in the middle of the floor and the other half missing completely. After speaking with the manager he informed me it must have ended up in the linen and would have housekeeping check and we would be on are way in no more then 5 - 10 minutes. Over 30 minutes later and having the complete run around my husband and I left empty handed only having to run to the mall to find a new swimsuit. That evening when I returned I gave the manager my reciept for the swimsuit and asked that something be done! He was very hesitant and said he would figure something out and talk to me in the morning when I checked out. Long story short he told me he had no proof I came with my swimsuit (other then mine or my husbands word) he had no proof it was there fault and that he would not be covering any of our unnecessary cost caused by them. I will never stay with another Holiday Inn after the way I was spoken to and treated!

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel with a scam at the end”
Reviews.Author: rob_hanson1979
Reviews.Content: I flew into Dubai late and had to get a hotel for the night as my other arrangements only began the next day. I took a taxi to a couple hotels, and found a room at the Holiday Inn. The location is fairly close to the airport, about a 7 minute drive. The hotel was fine, nice, clean, comfortable beds. I didn't walk around too much but the area seemed to be mostly offices and businesses. The next morning, I got up, took my luggage downstairs, and asked the doorman to get me a cab. I said I was just running across the street to the bank, and would be right back, When I got back, he had a towncar waiting for me. I told him I didn't want a towncar, just a taxi. He said it is a regular registered taxi, it was just a private one for hotel guests. Unfortunately, I should've insisted, but I as I was new to Dubai, I got in. Then the doorman got in.... the drivers seat. Yup, he was driving me! I asked again if this was a taxi and he said yes, same price as any other taxi. He drove me to the port, and the charge was about $60.US. Now, I wasn`t familiar with taxi charges in Dubai, nor the exchange rate on money, as I`d only been there a few hours. So I paid and went on my way. Only after did I realize how cheap taxis are in Dubai. If I was in a regular taxi, the whole trip would`ve cost me about $12US, not $60. I realize this is partially my fault, I should`ve prepared ahead of time to know the exchange rate, taxi rates, etc. However the doorman also clearly lied to me about the type of car and the rate he would charge. I imagine being close to the airport, the hotel gets a lot of travelers who are new to Dubai and you would think the hotel would be honest about these things. Anyways, this is a good decent hotel, a typical Holiday Inn. If you need somewhere to put your head comfortably for a night, it will do nicely. Just be careful when it comes to the taxi arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: boutondargent
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, near metro station; many shuttle opportunities : shuttle to the beach, to the shopping center and to and from the airport. Very good food and excellent room service, breakfast up to holiday Inn hotels standard, clean and pleasant pool, very helpful and attentive staff to remarks, complaints or compliments. Recommend executive floor : 7th floor. Free internet on this floor. Spent 11 nights in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “True and Genuine Service”
Reviews.Author: Ellis78
Reviews.Content: we stayed there with colleagues it was wonderful, I would deffenitaley recommend hotel to colleagues and friends, good location, within walking distance to Dubai Metrro, if you in bussiness and wanted good hotel, value for money, this is the place, staff are great, down to earth, friendly and really helpful, rooms fresh with good size and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not gonna stay there again & not even worth 4 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: reirei6
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 nights and here's what I think: *Location : is good AL RIGGA metro station is only 150 meters away you can go walking, bank of Abu Dhabi is near if you want to use the ATM, a couple of restaurants near by also a mini market or store you can get what you're missing of almost anything, CITY CENTER AL DEIRA you can go to it by taking the FREE shuttle bus & coming back and the trip is almost less than 15 min., but if you want to go to DUBAI MALL then you need to take the taxi and it costs about 20~25 Dirham (if the road was clear & no traffic jam), and in case you want to go to the MALL OF EMIRATES I suggest taking the metro train because it's cheaper, faster & you won't get caught in the traffic and ending up paying a lot of money using a taxi so if you want to have all the fun then stay in a hotel near Dubai mall ( I wished I stayed there instead). Hotel Services: their room service is slow I called for 2 cans of coke and it took 30~45 min 'till I received it & they said I'll get it within 5 min. (Hmmm...), their room service menu prices is reasonable but also is slow and you have to call more than 3 times to ask about your order, their TV channels is limited like only 5 enjoyable channels, if you're going to have their breakfast buffet which is located in the roof it's the same everyday and the cook there cooks the omelet in the corner and you can smell the smoke everywhere so I don't recommend you going there after a nice shower 'cause you'll smell like food for the whole day, I stayed in the standard rooms in the 4th floor & you can still hear the music coming from the club all the way from the 1st floor, you must pay for the internet in your room or in the lobby and it costs 60 DH for 2 hours & 90 DH for 24 hours, the room carpet smells so I advice you to walk wearing flip flops and don't be surprised if you found other people's stuff under your bed like I did I found a razor head (Ewww..) so be careful if you have infants from them picking anything from the floor, their mini bar is limited and I give them on a scale out of ten 1 and you have to ask for the ice, I found the light bulb on the desk is damaged & need to be replaced, their room phones & I'm talking about the receiver is disturbing you can't hear anything from the other person on the phone. So if you want to stay here think twice!!

Reviews.Title: “Dooobai”
Reviews.Author: banknorth
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, central location, cool, good-looking chicks in the disco and friendly ukrainians in teh coffee shop, shame there was no pool but there was always the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: khalid606
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the old area of Dubai (Deira, near Riga street). The hotel is clean, but there are some issues: - there is a night club in the 2st floor, and it’s too loud, so we couldn’t sleep. - the internet is not free, even in the lobby. - only few parking available for guests, you have to come early to find good parking. - the rooms are too small.

Reviews.Title: “DUBAI = beautiful city. HOLIDAY INN DOWNTOWN= extrodinary service.”
Reviews.Author: lutalica_no1
Reviews.Content: I don't normally take the time to write reviews, but after my recent stay at the Holiday Inn Downtown in Dubai, I somehow feel the need to tell everybody how exceptional this hotel was and a recommendation is a must. My mother and I booked a holiday to Dubai, Greece, Croatia, Serbia, Austria and London. We went to our travel agent who organised all accommodation and flights. We settled on holiday inn downtown as being new to Dubai we didn't know what to expect and we knew that Holiday Inn was well known. We were a bit hesitant when we arrived at Dubai airport. Travelling 15 hours from Australia that is expected. We had our transfer pick us up from the airport and within 10 minutes we were at our hotel. The moment we stepped into the hotel we automatically felt relaxed and at ease. Our check in experience was fantastic and the staff greeted us graciously. The amount of respect and kindness the staff have for you is unbelievable. We felt as if we were special guests and not just a number like we usually are treated in most hotels. Joy, the gentleman that worked in the lobby was fantastic. He told us everything we needed to know about Dubai, the key places to visit, the key things to try and the key shopping areas to make the most of our stay. He was always so cheerful and helpful. He is really one of a kind. Breakfast at the hotel was exceptional. We met a lady by the name of Nilan who always made sure we had everything we needed without having to ask. She was also a very friendly woman, always happy. With an attitude like that it made us really look forward to breakfast and the day ahead. The cleanliness of the rooms were excellent and the temperature was excellent. The cleaners always asked us when we would like our room cleaned and catered to it as apposed to most hotels where they do it when its convenient for them. Mohammed the hotel security guard always made us feel safe and secure, we felt as if we could knowingly leave the hotel for hours and not have to worry about our things or anybody trespassing through the building. There was also another lady who books tours, I cant remember her name, however she was very friendly and informative and catered to our needs. The facilities were fantastic. There is a gym, a pool, bistro, bar and room service. And the view from the top of the hotel is lovely. I recommend the desert safari tour, the city sights tour and the dinner cruise tour if you get the chance to ever visit Dubai which can be booked at the hotel. Dubai is such a beautiful city my mum and I are absolutely in love with it and I would go again in a heart beat. But I know that if it wasn't for the staff at the Holiday Inn Downtown, we probably wouldn't have been as open to all the experiences nor would we have appreciated the place as much as we do. We feel forever loyal to Holiday Inn Downtown and whenever I get the chance to go back to Dubai again I know that I don't need to worry about accommodation as that is where I definitely will be staying. We are now halfway through our trip and to be honest with you we are pretty disappointed with the accommodation so far. Holiday Inn Downtown really set the bench mark which I believe will be nearly impossible to beat. Thank you to all the staff at the Holiday Inn Downtown for your exceptional service and we will definitely see you again soon! Vesna.

Reviews.Title: “My Experince with Holiday inn Dubai down town.”
Reviews.Author: experience9
Reviews.Content: This is not only a word of just “thank you” but also to express my sincere thanks to the entire team of HI Down town colleagues. Hotel service standards have tremendously improved from my last visit. This is a really remarkable achievement. My self and my wife were in room 725 from 21st May to 24th May 2009. During my stay your HK colleagues were extremely helpful and were taken care of us very well. The room was supplied with adequate amenities always and well maintained the IHC standards. Overall the Room Attendants Sankar & Iqbal were very kind and generous to meet our requirements. The front office concierge Shakeel too very helpful and even the driver, sorry I forgot his name, assist me to send “Hotel show brochures” to Saudi Arabia through post office. So many other colleagues, again sorry I can’t remember everybody’s names, were also very attentive to our request and helpful during our stay in your hotel. Service from Reservation, Reception, and Room service to Lobby tea lounge was extremely out standing and remarkable. Keep up the good spirit. Kindly covey my best regards to all your colleagues and I wish them all the success with HI in down town and their future career. Wish you a pleasant summer. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the above reviews”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Scot5
Reviews.Content: We have just come back after four fantastic nights at this hotel. It is located in the heart of Deira, within walking distances of the creek, motor taxis, gold and spice souks and short taxi rides to both the Emirates and Deira malls. The staff were very friendly, the room spacious and spotlessly clean, the breakfasts varied and tasty and the pool well cleaned and maintained. There is a nightclub on the 1st floor of the hotel but as we were located on the 7th floor the noise didn't disturb us. All in all a super experience and I would not hesitate to go back and stay there. As for the review that said the hotel was dirty and dusty - you are in a city that is building a new underground system - there are building works going on everywhere - and YOU ARE IN A MIDDLE EAST ARID DESERT ENVIRONMENT - it WILL be dusty!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Inspector_to_be
Reviews.Content: Unless you want to stay near Deira (or the airport) and must stay in IHG property (Intercon Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn) – DO NOT stay in this hotel. Its beyond me how they are able to sustain the Holiday Inn brand… Great Location, and good Front Desk staff. The ambiance and furnishing and smell and noise and environment is appalling… There is a very small pool on the rooftop (no views) and some 3 weird looking rooms that I can only assume are either run down bars or shisha corners. It seems to be open late so the noise of people walking up and down the stairs will keep you awake all night (specially if staying in the ‘ Executive Floor’). For some reason you are not able to leave your bags in storage, so if you (like me) are planning an overnight trip to Abu Dhabi or other UAE location, it becomes a huge inconvenience. I didn’t understand the vibe of the hotel at first, but after reading a review in Trip Advisor of escorts offering their services in the hotel, it all falls into place – this hotel is a huge mess. Staff are polite but there is no attention to detail – asked for an internet code and was given it on a scrap paper which had other guets’ information (address. Rm number and amount paid) on the back!!! – I mean, how careless can it get? Yes, nice location, 15min from airport, but stay somewhere else, which cannot possibly be as bad!

Reviews.Title: “NIce Brothel , - if your in to that”
Reviews.Author: stevieb1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on business with other collegues. Our first experinece of this type of hotel in Dubai. We have always stayed in hoilday inns or crowne plazas around the world but this was the first that supplied 'Extras' if you know what i mean. During a business drink we were asked by a young lady if we wanted company, we declined thi offer but she stuck around until we left. we then found her there everynight pestering us during the stay. it got to a point we never went in there as we knew she would be there and found ourselves hidin from her. The indian disco is an experinece although you dont need to attend to hear the music. what ever floor you are on you will hear the music so if your using this hotel as a stop over to get sleep forget it as it goes on to 3am. The food is not good and the pool is a death trap with broken tiles and pool surrounds. There are only 2 sun loungers that are extremly dirty, (Dont believe the pictures on the web site). we paid approximetly £100 per night but even if the price was £50 i still would never stay. I emailed Hoilday Inn on my return and they offered 20000 bonus points and said they would contact the hotel, but looking at otehr reviews it dosent look as though they have changed it. I carried on with my complaint and was eventullay given a total of 70 000 points as compensation. The sooner Hoilday Inn remove this hotel from the group the better its brand will grow espesially with class hotels such as Crowne Plaza sheik Zayed Rd (one of the best hotels ever stayed) and the opening of the new Crowne Plaza at Festival City (which is cheaper than this Brothel). Did i mention that thenight club was also filled with women selling thereselves?

Reviews.Title: “Dubai here we come”
Reviews.Author: Creek-Dubai
Reviews.Content: I took my family to holiday in Dubai. I booked two rooms in this hotel thru Priority Club. The hotel room charges were way too much (Dhs 835-934) compared to other 4 Star hotel in the vacinity. The Only reason I booked this hotel is because of the name (Holiday Inn). The area close to the hotel is filthy and dirty and full of oil stains. Lots of papers lying around. The swimming pool was not up to the standard of a 4 star hotel. The pool was filthy and there was no attendants to look after you. The sun bathe chairs were filthy and dirty. The food is average. The worst part there is an Indian Disco club on the Ist Floor which is not owned by Holiday Inn Group who plays very loud music until 3-4 a.m. I think looking back, I made a terrible mistake in staying in Holiday Inn, Down Town Dubai. I certainly would not recommend this hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “never stay again in this bad 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: knight911
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from the travel agency for the period of Oct02 till Oct06 2008 for me and my friend for 650 DHS. We arrived hotel at 09:00 am and we waited for our room for 45 minutes because according to the receptionest our room is not ready yet and the room service needs to prepare and clean it. After we checked in at 10:00 am and we got to the room from the beginning the room was already renovates and new. Firstly, the minibar (fridge) was not working at all because all drinks inside are hot also the cover of pillows were dirty and when i talked to the room service they say ok and they are going to change both pillows and fridge. we slept for 2hours then we got back from the hotel after we remind them about these 2 issues after we got back after 5 hours we found nothing happened so I call them to come to my room maybe after 30 minutes they came and changed the pillows and they took a fridge with them at the beginning I thought that the technician will take the fridge to replace it with a new one but we waited for one hour then when I called them they said we do not have a fridge right now they will bring for us a new one tomorrow , I told him are you kidding. directly I requested to speak to the manager(after many tries from the receptionest to know what's the problem) I talked to the manager and I think he is from Pakistan about these issues then he said that he promised that these things will not happen again. Also when we arrived the hotel the reception insisted to have our passprots, however what we had only ID cards(there are an agreement among Gulf countries that the citizens can travel amongGulf countries by ID cards and no need for passports) like Europe by mistake I had a copy of my passport in my car but what about if I do not have?!? even the parking is very small and the most of it are not sun roofed. Finally I believe that the manager of the hotel does not know how to manage the hotel in appropriate way. Also the most of staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: IntlSalesGuy
Reviews.Content: The only reason why I booked this hotel is because it's a Holiday Inn. Bad decision. The hotel staff is not terribly friendly and it seems they were understaffed. The rooms are just ok. They are old and need renovating. There is an annoying night club on the first floor that plays loud music until 3am. I was on the 7th floor and could still hear it. I recommend staying on the opposite side of the hotel. I booked a non-smoking king bed Executive room. It is a waste of money. There is nothing special except that you get a trouser press and iron/ironing board. I tried the restaurant on the top floor and it was good. There are plenty of hotels in Dubai and I suggest looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as the other review said”
Reviews.Author: pensionerManchester
Reviews.Content: I had read quite a few reviews about the holiday inn and I must admit it worried me. I can honestly say we were pleasently surprised, it did not smell of old smoke. The bedroom was clean and large and quite well equipped. The hotel is not posh like you would expect in dubai but the location was really good we could walk to most places from the hotel. The creek was well within walking distance. would recomend this hotel as fairly cheap and convenient. The travel /concierge girl was really good really helpfull, she gave us lots of ideas and nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: qsqmqa
Reviews.Content: Although advertised as a 4-Star hotel, my guess that it is somewhere between a 2-3 star. I booked to stay for 2 nights but barely managed to stay for 14 hours. The hotel lobby was ridiculously small and smelled of tobacco. The property is understaffed and the staff at the Reception were ill-mannered. I went for an executive suite but it was a joke. Other than its large size, there is nothing to speak off. The property is tastelessly furnished and poorly equipped. Would never recommend this property to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: nzinitaly
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. Front desk was very helpfull and concierge knowledgable of the area and within in 10min organised a chauffer on short notice. During our stay we were not disturbed by any noise, maybe because we were on the business floor, however the our room lighting was poor, I had to open the drapes for more lighting. The room was very spacious and basic (nothing fancy) a bit dated maybe, but good enough for a short stay. Even though they had designated smoking areas, the stale odour of cigarettes and cigars cannot be disguised....

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better”
Reviews.Author: Ritanbob
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 6am to book for two nights and were given a room within an hour which was a help as we had just flown in from Bangkok and were tired. The reception staff were pleasant. The room was big, well furnished and clean - not much of an outlook though. However the servicing of the room was poor. First we had to ask for the tea making facilities, more towels and face cloths. The fridge obviously had not been cleaned for a while. The next day we went out at 10am. and on our return at 4.30pm. found the room had not been serviced so had to hang about the pool area for an hour while it was done with profuse apologies from the manager. Although the phone was working that day it was not the next day when we left so we had to struggle downstairs with our luggage. The method of getting you a taxi was for the concierge to stand outside and flag one down as it passed which you could do yourslf. Did not try the food as we thought 63drms. expensive for a breakfast. Heard no noise from the club and saw no ladies of the night although at our age (72) we were in the room reasonable early. Having stayed a few weeks before at the Al Sharjah Holiday Inn, the two in Bangkok and one in Singapore on this trip we were disappointed with this one and did not consider it good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “** Avoid it if you Can **”
Reviews.Author: TravelllerfromtheUK
Reviews.Content: I have recently been staying at the Downtown Holiday Inn. It has been during the time of Arab Health Conference so Dubai all the hotels are full, so this was not our choice to stay here. I have stayed in many Holiday Inns worldwide and in no way does this compare with any I have stayed in. The hotel is in Deira in not the nicest of areas, frequented by some dubious people going to the nightclub situated in the hotel. My room was on the third floor it was very noisey from the club, the bathroom had mould growing in the bath. Going in and out of the hotel you do not particulary feel safe and need to be aware of what is going on around you. Dubai is pretty crime free but singe females need to be aware. There are lots of choices nearby, Traders and Reinassance, if they are full avoid this if you can. We did not eat in the hotel but others have said that the food was not particulary good.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: scapaflow40
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn located in Deira Dubai is fairly good value. The rooms have good king sized beds and are clean. The location is not bad but you can get better value in the same area in my opinion. The front desk staff are effecient but not especially friendly but the bell staff are helpful. The very large bar on the first floor is rather empty in the early evening. It seems to get going later at night. If you like pool they have good tables. If you can get a room at under $200 then it is not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never Go Downtown !!!!Trust Me I Swear !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Farazali
Reviews.Content: On 22nd July i went to Holiday Inn Downtown after staying at Renaissance Hotel for a week , Obviously i had two days in Dubai left and had to chill but i couldnt. The Club known as 5th Avenue is on a rented premises and they dont care whether you stay in the hotel or not they would charge 50 dhs entrance fee each day, Somehow i managed to get in thanks to some amazing bell boys in the Hotel but than i was harrassed that i had to drink something or i should get lost, The Bartender/Owner was rude, can't a guy take a nice juice in a club ,check out some chiks pick them up ! well not in this one. Secondly when i thought that i had a bad night i called it a day and left the hotel within one day i was given a dead line for 2:15 pm and then i was told to keep the stuff in the lobby, Everywhere you would find an amazing 29 dhs deal for a perfect chicken or beef burger, thats what the posters say, But you will not get it as the deal is off, The Phone in my bathroom was broken, however the bed and the room was in good shape. The Reception on the TV was pathetic its better in alaska or Papua New Guinea. The Lady at the Reception was rude, Only the Reception guy who is of Egyptian Origin is friendly who comes at 4 pm shift, Bell Boys like Shakeel and Hotel Boys Like Hasif along with Basheer are friendly perhaps the seniors should learn. Even if you bring a girl over from any clubs you would be thouroughly asked whether your room allows a female or not ? The Point is if someone is in Dubai and books this hotel ,is it stated in the form that this room allows a female or not in a single standard room? You call this 4 star. Mind You the Tooth Brush and Tooth Paste are on Request in case you dont bring your own!

Reviews.Title: “Please DON'T go this hotel, unless you want to be get ripped off !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had no choice but to use Holiday Inn DT Dubai this week because it was the only hotel I can get during he exhibition period. They cheated me sly with the room rates, using this busy exhibition season. I respect the founder of Holiday Inn, but this time I'm very disappointed at the Holiday Inn Downtown Dubai.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Downtown Dubai
HotelInfo.Address: Al Rigga rd, Dubai 29499, United Arab Emirates
